tool.help:
This tool allows you to export one or more files to a registered `AARNET Cloudstor`_ account. |logo_image|
.. |logo_image| image:: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/usegalaxy-au/Galaxy-Owncloud-Integration/master/Galaxy_OwncloudImportExport/images/cloudstor_logo.png :width: 128px
Firstly you will need to configure access to the target Cloudstor account. Best practice is to setup an app specific password in Cloudstor for Galaxy to use. Click `here for instructions`_.
Next, in Galaxy, go to your profile settings under the User menu -> Preferences -> Manage Information, where you will need to set OwnCloud/Cloudstor Credentials.
.. image:: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/usegalaxy-au/Galaxy-Owncloud-Integration/master/Galaxy_OwncloudImportExport/images/galaxy_cloudstor_profile.png
1. Server URL: https://cloudstor.aarnet.edu.au/plus/remote.php/webdav 2. Username: The email your account is registered with 3. Password: Copied from the App password set up at Cloudstor
If the details above are configured properly, the next time you load this tool, the directories in your CloudStor account will be displayed. Select the file you want to export and the directory you want to export to and press Execute.
.. class:: warningmark
**CAUTION** This tool WILL overwrite existing files, so choose your target folder carefully!
Your Cloudstor credentials will be stored on this server. While reasonable efforts have been made to store these credentials safely, you must be aware and accept the risks of storing these credentials. In the event that the server is compromised, it may be possible for an attacker to gain access to your Cloudstor account.
.. _AARNET Cloudstor: https://www.aarnet.edu.au/network-and-services/cloud-services/cloudstor/ .. _here for instructions: https://support.aarnet.edu.au/hc/en-us/articles/236034707-How-do-I-manage-change-my-passwords-
